doc:
Julie Haydon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julie_Haydon 0 For the American short story writer (1939–1981), see Julie HaydenJulie Haydon (born Donella Donaldson, June 10, 1910 – December 24, 1994) was an American Broadway, film and television actress who received second billing as the female lead in the Ben Hecht–Charles MacArthur 1935 film vehicle for Noel Coward, The Scoundrel. After her Hollywood career ended in 1937, she turned to the theatre, originating the roles of Kitty Duval in The Time of Your Life (1939) and Laura Wingfield in The Glass Menagerie (1945). For the_American_short_story_writer ( 1939 – 1981 ) , see Julie_HaydenJulie_Haydon ( born Donella_Donaldson , June_10_,_1910 – December_24_,_1994 ) was an_American_Broadway_,_film_and_television_actress who received second_billing as the_female_lead in the_Ben_Hecht – Charles_MacArthur_1935_film_vehicle for Noel_Coward , The_Scoundrel . After her_Hollywood_career ended in 1937 , she turned to the_theatre , originating the_roles of Kitty_Duval in The_Time of Your_Life_(_1939_)_and_Laura_Wingfield in The_Glass_Menagerie ( 1945_) .
